oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1956-04-14 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from April 14, 1956. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Faron Young (host/performer), guest performers Lonzo & Oscar, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Gordon Terry, Dale Potter, Lew Childre, the Country Deputies, Del Wood, Minnie Pearl, and Chet Atkins. During the show Grant Turner presents Faron Young with a plaque for winning the Farm & Ranch magazine poll for favorite country music artist of 1955, conducted by Jimmy Rule. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Del Wood; Minnie Pearl; Rod Brasfield; Lonzo & Oscar; Chet Atkins; Faron Young
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Down Yonder (Del Wood) [continued from part 1] -- Faron Young introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl, Rod Brasfield, Faron Young) -- Faron Young introduces Lonzo & Oscar -- Cattle Call No. 2 (Lonzo & Oscar) -- Faron Young introduces Chet Atkins -- [Unidentified guitar instrumental] (Chet Atkins) -- Grant Turner presents Faron Young with a Farm & Ranch magazine award -- Faron Young talks -- You're Still Mine (Faron Young) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Faron Young) -- Cavalier Cigarettes commercial -- Station announcements
